meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Captain Lawrence Indyk Sara Shiver Joel Pool Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6386.

td.p: Captain Lawrence Indyk, a JAG attorney from Lawrence, Kansas
Sara Shiver, a periodicals librarian from Columbia, South Carolina
Joel Pool, a real estate developer from Oakland, California (whose 5-day cash winnings total $95,300)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'In "Charlie and the Chocolate Factory", Johnny played this candy man')

Lewis & Clark knew they\'d be meeting tribal elders on their trip, so they took with them special peace medals that looked like this to give as gifts; one of the original medals issued by this president was found here along the Palouse River')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from Idaho along the banks of the Palouse River.) Lewis & Clark knew they'd be meeting tribal elders on their trip, so they took with them special peace medals that looked like this to give as gifts; one of the original medals issued by this president was found here along the Palouse River

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_4', 'clue_J_6_4_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from Ft. Clatsop in Oregon.) Needing shelter for the winter of 1805-1806, Lewis & Clark built Ft. Clatsop, the first military structure west of the Rockies, and named it in honor of the local Clatsop Tribe, a branch of this Native American people whose name reflects a culture based on a type of salmon')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from Ft. Clatsop in Oregon.) Needing shelter for the winter of 1805-1806, Lewis & Clark built Ft. Clatsop, the first military structure west of the Rockies, and named it in honor of the local Clatsop Tribe, a branch of this Native American people whose name reflects a culture based on a type of salmon

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_5', 'clue_J_6_5_stuck', '(Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from the Pacific shore in Oregon on a cold, windy day.) "Ocean in view! O! the joy!" Clark wrote, as their goal was in sight, probably on a day much like today; though they had failed to find the Northwest Passage, the expedition had learned much of the overland route & the course of this river, the largest to flow into the Pacific')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from the Pacific shore in Oregon on a cold, windy day.) "Ocean in view! O! the joy!" Clark wrote, as their goal was in sight, probably on a day much like today; though they had failed to find the Northwest Passage, the expedition had learned much of the overland route & the course of this river, the largest to flow into the Pacific
